channel.title: Japanese on Table41NYC
channel.description: Recent content in Japanese on Table41NYC

item.title: Tonkatsu Matsunoya
item.description: This place is pretty bomb and NO TIP NEEDED! Would come back here again. The crust was really good.

item.title: Mi Ne Sushi
item.description: Just ok and also cheap sushi. Not great. Don’t trust people when they say this is good sushi.

item.title: Momoya
item.description: Just ok. Cheap sushi. Don’t trust people’s palettes when they say this place is good.

item.title: Kazunori
item.description: Spawned off LA’s Sugarfish. Cheap 6 piece hand rolls. $32 includes tax, tip, and a Mexican coke. Still room for dessert unfortunately.

item.title: Tsurutontan
item.description: Pretty decent udon. Got the kimchi jigae variant. A bit sweet and would try something else. Came back here another time, and the basic variant was probably better than everything else. Some of the fancier udon variants are just not that great.

item.title: Sushi on Jones
item.description: Another omakase. Decent sushi place. Fast in/out in 20 minutes. $58 total. Got an extra toro/uni hand roll which added another $20ish.

item.title: Ootoya
item.description: Pretty good bento boxing place. A little pricey but no need to tip.

item.title: Nakazawa
item.description: It’s an Omakase. Michelin 1 star. Very good for the price. Got sake pairing + sushi + EXTRAS… only $220 per person. The lychee sorbet was awesome.

item.title: Shuko
item.description: Really good. Got the kaiseki ($175), and they gave a lot of sushi pieces. The dessert, rhubarb sorbet, was really good.

item.title: Shabu Tatsu
item.description: Fairly inexpensive, but not very OG. Portions are small, and no where as good as LA shabu shabu.

item.title: Robataya Ny
item.description: This place was such a gimmick. Very showy like Benihanas but way worse. Food was just ok and super pricey. They have bday celebrations… super weird. But it’s CLOSED.

item.title: Mew Men
item.description: Japanese lunch was cheap and good. But this place is CLOSED now replaced by Menkoi Sato, a ramen place.

item.title: Sake Bar Hagi
item.description: Decent yakitori skewers, but that’s about it. A bit pricey and always a line.

item.title: Abiko Curry
item.description: One of my top favorite curry places. Warning: the medium is actually pretty spicy.

item.title: Curry Ya
item.description: The spicy pork tonkatsu was pretty good. One of the better Japanese curry places in the city.

item.title: Uma Temakeria
item.description: Terrible “sushi burrito” This place is CLOSED for obvious reasons.

item.title: Go Go Curry
item.description: Good lunch spot and fast. Cheap.
